result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel R Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.  No use of possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No contact with children under the age of 16 without consent of DOC.  No contact with victim.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession. Voting and Child sex offender working with children.

Successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program. Cognitive thinking intervention counseling. Attend parenting class.  Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent. Register and comply with the lifetime sex offender registry. Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.  Pay child support, failure to pay child support will result in revocation.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment. Absolute sobriety with monthly random urine screens.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Pay all supervision fees. Restitution set at ZERO.  Pay all costs, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge and assessments by the end of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restriction:  Firearm possession.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program. Defendant is not appropriate for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel R Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Independent pre sentence report provided by defense counsel received and filed.

Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Br 38 for Br 12. 
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting and Child sex offender working with children.
Defense will be submitting a private presentencing investigations.  
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  Jury trial date of 4/14/2014 is vacated.
Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-06-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant pro-se letter received and filed.
Defendant pro-se letter received and filed.
Defendant pro-se letter received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Diane Rose Caspari in court appeared via telephone, defendant Nathaniel R Smith not in court, in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Caspari did not appear as she is ill. Date for plea hearing discussed via telephone. Parties notified. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial 4/14/14 at 8:30 a.m.
Case adjourned to Br. 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant received and filed in 13CF5589.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Letter from the defendant received and filed in case 13CF5589.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in court with attorney Diane R Caspari.  Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for motion to consolidate 13CF5589 and 14CF4.  Defense is not objecting to the consolidation of the case. Court ordered case 13CF5589 and 14CF4 consolidated for trial.  Parties are working on a resolution to this matter.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 4/14/2014 at 8:30 a.m. Parties will advise the court if the matter will resolve.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 03-10-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Diane R Caspari in court, defendant Nathaniel R Smith not in court, in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Judge Kremers for Judge Borowski.  
Case scheduled for scheduling conference.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Joiner of 13CF5589 and 14CF4 received and filed.  Defense request a motion hearing.  State will provide an offer to defense. 
Case set for motion hearing on 1/31/2014 at 2:30pm.  Jury trial set for 4/14/2014 at 8:30am.  Case is adjourned to Br 12.

Signed and Filed, COURT ORDER Rescinding Defndant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privleges.
Filed, Telephone Call Transcript.

Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in court with attorney Diane R Caspari.  Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Gary Brown-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12 due to lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 01-10-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Drug testing.

No drugs without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.C.G.   AND/OR  her residence   AND/OR  her place of employment or school

Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Nathaniel R Smith in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant has a lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
